title: 'We will get better' - Gatland insists Wales will improve after win against Georgia – video
text: It was a tale of two halves for Wales as they scored six tries against Georgia in Toyota City. Warren Gatland's side found themselves 29-0 up as tries from Jonathan Davies, Justin Tipuric, Josh Adams and Liam Williams secured a bonus point before half-time, but Georgia fought back strongly in the second half. "We know as a team that we tend to get better as tournaments go on," said head coach Gatland. "Pleased with the start today, but we know there is a lot of room for us to improve for next week." Wales will face Australia in Tokyo on Sunday in a shoot-out for top spot in Pool D.
description: A lightning-fast start from Wales saw them earn a bonus point before half-time, before a spirited Georgia recovery after the break
